title: Which is true of two thrown stones

content.prompt: Two stones, represented in the figure above, are thrown from the same height with the same initial speed. Stone A is thrown vertically downward and stone B is thrown horizontally. If the stones are thrown at the same time and air resistance is negligible, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The two stones will reach the ground at the same time with the same speed.
The two stones will reach the ground at the same time but with different speeds.
Stone A will reach the ground first, but stone B will have the greater speed just before hitting the ground.
Stone A will reach the ground first, but the two stones will have the same speed just before they hit the ground.
Stone A will reach the ground first, and will have the greater speed just before hitting the ground.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
